result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Lisowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: consecutive to the sentence defendant is presently serving.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Court costs also including from count 4.

supervisions.notes: to commence today, concurrent with any other sentence presently serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J. Lisowski

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 2:17 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Losowski appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Nathan Heim in court for defendant. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 06-17-22 at 3:00 p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel J. Lisowski
Current: 423 Birchwood Drive, Francis Creek, WI   (Effective: 05-06-2022)
Prior: 13130 White Cedar Road, Two Rivers, WI 54241
RE:  Possess Fentanyl-2nd or subsequent offense, on 04-30-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess cocaine, possess THC, possess Fentanyl with intent to deliver and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-23-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Cool City Motel and maintain absolute sobriety.    Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold. Court orders photos and prints at TRPD.
Minutes.
